messages.message:
We are hiring if you like Denver.
Data sciences, platform engineer, internal tools

Brian
Google is a lot of spaghetti? They always did seem like the types to tack on an API at the end, must be why they are constantly shutting down projects and starting new ones.
I really like the sound of DevOps but it is hard to explain to people what it is for. Just some new buzz word.
No, my new place is spaghetti

It's not terrible, I have seen worse; but its hard to evolve.
The main problem relies in reporting.
I can change the system to add a new feature in a few hours or days, depending on the scope; but figuring out the downstream reporting impacts for that is hugely time consuming.
I spent a two weeks figuring out what revenue was and how we derived it.

Brian
Yeah that is tough. Looks highly advertising based?
Similar business model as Google, revenue is advertising, customer benefit is cash back (whereas Google provides free services).

Brian
One of our fellow hackers works for Snap Inc. and loves it. Good to catch up, I have to go to sleep and go deal with these meetings at 5:30 am. Cheers!

Brian
Q: What's the difference between a TV and a newspaper?
A: Ever tried swatting a fly with a TV?

Back at you bud
Happy thanks-day
